item.title: Israel says 'misidentification led to a mistake' as Biden outraged over aid deaths
item.description: Biden 'outraged' at Israel over Gaza aid convoy deaths

media:content.media:description: Pro-Palestinian demonstrators outside the White House on April 2, 2024

item.title: Taiwan’s strongest earthquake in 25 years kills at least 9
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Jett and Janis Mackey Frayer and Dawn Liu and Rae Wang and Emma Li and Arata Yamamoto and Larissa Gao and Phil Helsel
item.description: A 7.4-magnitude earthquake struck Wednesday off the coast of Taiwan, killing at least four people in the island’s most powerful tremor in at least 25 years.

media:content.media:text: A damaged building in Hualien City, Taiwan, after an earthquake
media:content.media:description: A damaged building in Hualien City, Taiwan, after an earthquake on April 3, 2024.

media:content.media:text: Worst Taiwan Quake in 25 Years Levels Buildings
media:content.media:description: A collapsed road in New Taipei City following the earthquake.

media:content.media:text: Taiwan Earthquake Damage
media:content.media:description: A local resident inspects damage to a brick wall inside a home in Taipei.

item.title: Oklahoma official with white nationalist ties is ousted in recall vote
item.dc:creator: Brandy Zadrozny and Nnamdi Egwuonwu and Micki Fahner
item.description: Judd Blevins, a city councilman who has white nationalist ties, lost his recall election in Enid, Oklahoma, on Tuesday. Cheryl Patterson will replace him.

media:content.media:credit: Michael Noble Jr. for NBC News
media:content.media:text: Judd Blevins holds a campaign sign in Enid.
media:content.media:description: Judd Blevins campaigned in Enid, Okla., on Tuesday.

media:content.media:credit: Michael Noble Jr. for NBC News
media:content.media:text: Candidate Cheryl Patterson poses for a portrait
media:content.media:description: Cheryl Patterson said she hoped the results would show that Enid residents stood against white nationalism.

media:content.media:credit: Michael Noble Jr. for NBC News
media:content.media:text: Connie Vickers, center, chats with a friend at the end of an Enid Social Justice Committee meeting on March 4.
media:content.media:description: Connie Vickers, center, chats with a friend at the end of an Enid Social Justice Committee meeting on March 4.

media:content.media:credit: Michael Noble Jr. for NBC News
media:content.media:text: A Judd Blevins supporter waves a sign to passing cars.
media:content.media:description: A Blevins supporter said she liked what he had done on the City Council over the past year.

media:content.media:credit: Michael Noble Jr. for NBC News
media:content.media:text: Connie Vickers casts her vote
media:content.media:description: Connie Vickers casts her vote Tuesday.

media:content.media:credit: Michael Noble Jr. for NBC News
media:content.media:text: Judd Blevins walks with a rolled-up flag.
media:content.media:description: Judd Blevins said he was “opposed to all forms of racial hate and racial discrimination."

media:content.media:credit: Michael Noble Jr. for NBC News
media:content.media:text: Member of Enid Social Justice Committee Connie Vickers and Leslie Terrell cheer
media:content.media:description: Connie Vickers and other members of the Enid Social Justice Committee cheer as Cheryl Patterson maintains her lead Tuesday.

media:content.media:credit: Michael Noble Jr. for NBC News
media:content.media:text: Kristi Balden hands out agendas during a ESJC Social Justice Committee meeting.
media:content.media:description: Kristi Balden, chair of the Enid Social Justice Committee, at a meeting on March 4.

media:content.media:credit: Michael Noble Jr. for NBC News
media:content.media:text: Cheryl Patterson waves while holding a campaign sign.
media:content.media:description: Patterson campaigns Tuesday.

item.title: Trump sues Truth Social co-founders, says they're not entitled to stock shares
item.dc:creator: Dareh Gregorian
item.description: Former President Donald Trump has sued the co-founders of Truth Social, alleging they mismanaged the social media platform early on and should therefore lose their stock in the company, which recently went public.

media:content.media:text: Former President Donald Trump makes a speech as he attends the 2024 Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC)
media:content.media:description: Former President Donald Trump makes a speech as he attends the 2024 Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC) in National Harbor, Md., on Feb. 24, 2024.

item.title: Teen, reported kidnapped, was fatally shot by deputies as she obeyed their commands, video shows
item.dc:creator: Marlene Lenthang and The Associated Press
item.description: A California teenager whose father was believed to have kidnapped her in September 2022 was fatally shot by deputies as she followed their commands, and she didn’t appear to be wearing tactical gear as officials previously claimed, newly released video shows.

media:content.media:credit: City of Fontana Police Department via AP
media:content.media:text: Abducted teen Savannah Graziano. Graziano, abducted by her father a day earlier, was killed amid a shootout with law enforcement Tuesday, Sept. 27, 2022, on a highway in California's high desert, authorities said.
media:content.media:description: Savannah Graziano.

media:content.media:text: Abducted teen Savannah Graziano. Graziano, abducted by her father a day earlier, was killed amid a shootout with law enforcement Tuesday, Sept. 27, 2022, on a highway in California's high desert, authorities said.
media:content.media:description: Savannah Graziano.

item.title: Glorb, 'SpongeBob' raps and the wild west of AI-generated music
item.dc:creator: Kalhan Rosenblatt
item.description: At first, the YouTube videos look like scenes from Nickelodeon’s popular “SpongeBob SquarePants” cartoon.

media:content.media:text: A SpongeBob character model stars in Glorb's music video "The Bottom 2."
media:content.media:description: A SpongeBob character model stars in Glorb's music video "The Bottom 2," animated by ThrillDaWill.

media:content.media:text: SpongeBob appears in Glorb's music video "EUGENE."
media:content.media:description: A SpongeBob character model appears in Glorb's music video "EUGENE," animated by ThrillDaWill.

item.title: Tornado threats, heavy rain and snow expected as dangerous spring storms threaten millions
item.dc:creator: Steve Strouss and Austin Mullen and Minyvonne Burke and Kathryn Prociv and Phil Helsel
item.description: A likely tornado moved or rolled mobile homes and uprooted trees in Kentucky and buildings were damaged in Tennessee as severe weather swept across those and other states Tuesday, putting millions under weather alerts, officials said.

media:content.media:text: A garage in Barnsdall completely collapsed
media:content.media:description: A garage in Barnsdall, Ohio, completely collapsed after a tornado ripped through the town on April 1, 2024.

media:content.media:text: Heavy rain causes flooding near the area of North High St. in Columbus, Ohio, on April 2, 2024.
media:content.media:description: Heavy rain causes flooding Tuesday in Columbus, Ohio.

item.title: White House holds press briefing
item.description: Watch live coverage as White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre holds a press briefing.

media:content.media:title: White House holds press briefing
media:content.media:description: Watch live coverage as White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre holds a press briefing.

item.title: Suspects in the stabbing of an Iranian presenter fled U.K. after attack, counterterrorism police say
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: British counterterrorism police investigating the stabbing of a journalist who works for a TV channel critical of the Iranian government said that three suspects had fled the country within hours of the attack.

media:content.media:text: Suspects in the stabbing of an Iranian presenter fled UK after attack, counterterrorism police say
media:content.media:description: Pouria Zeraati in an image released on March 30, 2024.

item.title: Ugandan court rejects bid to nullify anti-gay law that provides for the death penalty in some cases
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Uganda’s constitutional court on Wednesday upheld an anti-gay law that allows the death penalty for “aggravated homosexuality.”

media:content.media:credit: Gallo Images via Getty Images file
media:content.media:text: EFF Picket Against Uganda's Anti-Homosexuality Bill In South Africa
media:content.media:description: Activists picket against Uganda's anti-homosexuality bill at the Uganda High Commission on April 4, 2023 in Pretoria, South Africa.

item.title: Chuck Todd: Prepare for lots of campaign motion — and little actual movement
item.dc:creator: Chuck Todd
item.description: If history is any guide, it’s likely we aren’t going to see any significant movement in the polls until the very last minute of the 2024 election.

item.title: North Korea says it tested a new hypersonic intermediate-range missile that uses solid propellants
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: North Korea said Wednesday it had tested a new hypersonic intermediate-range missile powered with solid propellants, extending a run in weapons demonstrations that’s deepening a nuclear standoff with neighbors and the United States.

media:content.media:text: North Korea says it tested a new hypersonic intermediate-range missile that uses solid propellants
media:content.media:description: Images taken on Tuesday show the first test-fire of North Korean Hwasongpho-16B, a new-type intermediate-range fuelled ballistic missile.

media:content.media:text: North Korea says it tested a new hypersonic intermediate-range missile that uses solid propellants
media:content.media:description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un inspecting the first test-fire, which took place in the suburbs of Pyongyang on Tuesday.

item.title: Russia says concert attack sparked jump in army recruitment as Ukraine lowers conscription age to boost troop numbers
item.dc:creator: Reuters and The Associated Press
item.description: Russia has seen a significant jump in the number of people signing contracts to join the armed forces since last month’s deadly attack on a concert hall near Moscow, the defense ministry said on Wednesday.

media:content.media:text: Russia Military Recruitment Moscow
media:content.media:description: A sign reads "Our profession is defending the Motherland" at a Russian military recruitment point in Moscow.

media:content.media:text: Ukraine on Wednesday, April 3, 2024, lowered the military conscription age from 27 to 25 in an effort to replenish its depleted ranks after more than two years of war following Russia’s full-scale invasion.
media:content.media:description: Conscription has been a sensitive matter in Ukraine and a growing shortage of infantry has helped hand Russia the battlefield initiative.

item.title: Rep. Lauren Boebert undergoes surgery for blood clot in leg
item.dc:creator: Phil Helsel
item.description: U.S. Rep. Lauren Boebert underwent surgery Tuesday after a blood clot was found in her leg, and she has been diagnosed with a vascular condition, her campaign said Tuesday night.

media:content.media:text: Rep. Lauren Boebert
media:content.media:description: Lauren Boebert at the U.S. Capitol, on March 13, 2024.

item.title: Wisconsin voters approve two GOP-backed ballot measures that will change how elections are run
item.dc:creator: Adam Edelman
item.description: Wisconsin residents voted on two ballot measures Tuesday: one on whether to ban private fund use in elections, and another clarifying the roles of election workers.

media:content.media:text: Wisconsin residents vote in the Presidential Primary election.
media:content.media:description: Wisconsin residents vote in the presidential primary election in Douglas County, Wis., on Tuesday.

item.title: Biden 'outraged' by Israeli strike that killed aid workers in Gaza
item.dc:creator: Megan Lebowitz
item.description: The president's statement — his first comments on the deaths of World Central Kitchen humanitarian workers — contained some of his strongest criticism of Israel.

media:content.media:text: President Joe Biden delivers remarks at the White House
media:content.media:description: President Joe Biden in the Roosevelt Room of the White House on March 26.

item.title: Iowa-LSU draws 12.3 million viewers, most in women's CBB history
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosenstein
item.description: Iowa’s 94-87 win against LSU in the Elite Eight on Monday drew 12.3 million viewers, the most in women’s college basketball history, according to ESPN.

media:content.media:text: Image: LSU v Iowa
media:content.media:description: Caitlin Clark #22 of the Iowa Hawkeyes celebrates after beating the LSU Tigers 94-87 in the Elite 8 round of the NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament on April 1, 2024 in Albany, N.Y.

media:content.media:text: Image: LSU v Iowa
media:content.media:description: Angel Reese of the LSU Tigers against the Iowa Hawkeyes in the Elite Eight round of the NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament in Albany, N.Y., on Monday.

item.title: Trump makes new request seeking recusal of judge in hush money case
item.dc:creator: Zoë Richards and Dan Mangan, CNBC and Lisa Rubin
item.description: Donald Trump’s lawyers are making another attempt to have Judge Juan Merchan remove himself from the New York hush money trial.

media:content.media:text: Image: Former President Donald Trump
media:content.media:description: Former President Donald Trump speaks after a hearing at New York Criminal Court on March 25.

item.title: Trump returns to Wisconsin with false claims that he won the state in 2020
item.dc:creator: Matt Dixon and Jake Traylor and Sarah Dean
item.description: Trump returned to Wisconsin for the first time in nearly two years, re-introducing himself to the battleground state with misleading claims about the 2020 election.

media:content.media:text: Republican presidential candidate and former U.S. President Donald Trump's campaign rally in Green Bay
media:content.media:description: Former President Donald Trump attends a campaign rally in Green Bay, Wisc., on April 2, 2024.

item.title: Trump sues Truth Social co-founders, says they're not entitled to stock shares
item.dc:creator: Dareh Gregorian
item.description: Former President Donald Trump has sued the co-founders of Truth Social, alleging they mismanaged the social media platform early on and should therefore lose their stock in the company, which recently went public.

item.title: Trump vows he'll have a 'statement' on abortion 'next week'
item.dc:creator: Natasha Korecki and Gabe Gutierrez and Jake Traylor
item.description: Trump on Tuesday announced that his campaign would address the issue of abortion next week, a move that comes just after a Florida court paved the way for a six-week ban on the procedure.

media:content.media:text: Image: FFormer President Donald Trump
media:content.media:description: Former President Donald Trump speaks at a campaign event on April 2, 2024 in Grand Rapids, Mich.

item.title: Several Trump supporters involved in Jan. 6 are running for office this year
item.dc:creator: Diana Paulsen and Monica Dunn and Kelly Davis and Abigail Russ
item.description: Several Trump supporters who were in Washington on Jan. 6, including rioters who stormed the Capitol, are running for office in the 2024 elections.

media:content.media:description: Jacob Chansley at the Capitol riots on Jan. 6, 2021.
